newsitem.title: USA: Analyst sees weak Q4 for Union Carbide.
newsitem.headline: Analyst sees weak Q4 for Union Carbide.

text.p: PaineWebber analyst Paul Raman said his downgrade of Union Carbide Corp shares to neutral from attractive reflected his expectations of a weaker-than-expected fourth quarter and declining profitability prospects in the company's polyethelene business.

"Basically there's a declining polyethelene business," Raman said. Oil and gas feedstock prices were rising, and an estimated $700 million to $800 million in expected capacity expansions would weaken earnings, he said.
Fourth quarter earnings could be as low as $0.85 a share, against consensus estimates of about $1.00, he said.
Raman said the stock was nearly fully valued at current prices.
